intro: Arequipa hempeliana, commonly known as the Arequipa hempeliana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features include a slender stem and aromatic foliage, which contribute to its ecological role in its native habitat. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
